wikipedia_page.main: Ada Ward was an English actress and singer who became a star in Australia in the 1870s, and later worked in the United States. She caused a sensation in 1897 by leaving the stage and joining the Salvation Army as a preacher and going on to work in the slums of London.

response: *Ada Ward, English actress and singer who became a star in Australia in the 1870s, and later worked in the United States
*6 May 1913: Bomb placed on the steps of the Grand Hotel in Northumberland Avenue, Charing Cross, London by Ada Ward. A policeman who observed her place the bomb defused it and arrested Ward.
